intro: Railliardia vafra, commonly known as the Vafra orchid, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, showy blooms that typically feature vibrant colors such as pink, purple, and white. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil to flourish. Its unique floral structure includes specialized sepals and petals that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Railliardia vafra is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
